warning.title: Warning — Debian's release cycle is different from Publican's
warning.para: This means that the current stable version of the Debian distribution is likely to contain an older version of publican. ***********THIS PROCEDURE ASSUMES sudo IS INSTALLED - WHICH IS NOT DEFAULT****************

section.para: Assuming there is a more recent version of publican available in the testing repository, and that you are running the current stable, then you can upgrade by:

step.para: Open your /etc/apt/sources.list file in a text editor. For example, to edit the file in gedit run:
Add the following line to the end of the file:
step.programlisting: #### testing ######### deb http://ftp.us.Debian.org/Debian testing main contrib non-free

step.para: Save the file and close the text editor.
Open (or create) your /etc/apt/preferences file in a text editor. For example, to edit the file in gedit run:
Add the following line to the end of the file:
step.programlisting:
Package: * Pin: release a=stable Pin-Priority: 900
Package: * Pin: release a=testing Pin-Priority: 400
Package: * Pin: release o=Debian Pin-Priority: -10

step.para: Save the file and close the text editor.
